actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to waive, for purposes of enabling members of the uniformed services assigned to duty outside the United States to be eligible for the earned income credit, the requirement that the principal place of abode of such members must be in the United States.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide that members of the uniformed services assigned to duty outside the United States shall be eligible for the earned income credit.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to waive, for purposes of enabling members of the uniformed services assigned to duty outside the United States to be eligible for the earned income credit, the requirement that the principal place of abode of such members must be in the United States.
